subsection.name: Launch a single computation
subsection.p: To execute the calculation of the distances, you must select input files using the menus File / Open particles A et File / Open particles B. Then you can launch the compution by pressing the Launch button. A dialogbox will appear to ask you the prefix of the outputs files. Once this step is accomplished, the computation will run.
While the computation, you can monitor the progress of Corsen with the progress bar the log on the main tab.
When the calculation is complete, the results, 3D View and History tab will be updated.

subsection.name: 3D visualisation only
subsection.p: To only use the 3D visualisation functionality of Corsen, follow the same steps that if you want launch a single computation but press on 3D View instead of Launch.

subsection.name: Use Corsen in batch mode
subsection.p: If you want to use Corsen on several images in the aim to do statistical work, it will be more easier to use Corsen in batch mode. Before launching Corsen you must defined in the Particles tab of the settings of Corsen, the prefixes of the files to use (for each type of particles). Then select the directory of the file to analyse with menu File / Open a directory, and press the launch button to run the computation.
As for a single computation all the tabs will be update during the progress the calculation of data.

subsection.name: The Results tab
subsection.p: The result tab contains informations about the last cell that has been analyzed by Corsen. You can select type of information to display with the combobox at top of the tab.

subsection.p: In this tab, Corsen allow you to save filtered particles (the filter can be set in the application settings) and result files. The type of particles to save or result to save is selected with the same combobox used to choose result table and graph to show.

subsection.name: 3D visualisation
subsection.p: In this tab, a 3D visualization of the last particles A and B analyzed is displayed. For each type of particles you can select the visualization mode :
In addition, two checkboxes allow to show minumum distances and the barycenter of particles. Unlike the input filtering, the filtering view in this tab will only have effects on the 3D visualization.

subsection.name: The History tab
subsection.p: The History tab summaries the results of all previous Corsen computation. The table show for each previous calculation, the inputs files and a result from Coren computation. The result (mean, median, min, max) to show can be selected with the combobox.

The list of result type to display, there is an item called "custom". The custom statistic represents the percent of distances that pass a test. The expression of the test is defined in Corsen settings.

The plots on the bottom of the tab show a boxplot and a distribution for the table values. The plots are drawn if there is more than 2 values in the table. The table can be cleared by press the clear button.
